content:
• Wednesday, February 8, 2017
  • JAGX

    Jaguar Animal Health to merge with Napo Pharmaceuticals

    • Jaguar Animal Health (NASDAQ:JAGX) +66% AH after announcing a merger agreement with Napo Pharmaceuticals.
    • Binding financial terms of merger include a 3-to-1 Napo-to-Jaguar value ratio to calculate relative ownership of the combined entity.
    • JAGX says the merger provide it with an important prescription revenue stream from sales of Mytesi, an FDA-approved human drug for the symptomatic relief of noninfectious diarrhea in adults with HIV/AIDS on antiretroviral therapy.
    • Napo already owned ~19% of JAGX's outstanding common shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 PM
  • CREE

    Cree -3.43%; sale of Wolfspeed business to Infineon Technologies unlikely to be approved by CFIUS

    • Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) and Infineon Technologies (IFNNF, IFNNY) note exploration of alternatives to modify current form of the arrangement to alleviate or address regulatory issues, though any outcome to that end remains uncertain.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • PAYC

    Paycom +10.47%; Q4 2016, forecasts positive

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $87.8M (+34.8% Y/Y, $1.48M above estimates), EPS $0.18 ($0.05 above estimates), adjusted EBITDA $20.7M (+97.4% Y/Y), net income $10.8M, cash and cash equivalents $60.2M, total debt $29.8M
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $114.5M-$116.5M (consensus $113.32), adjusted EBITDA $42M-$44M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $422M-$424M (consensus $421.56), adjusted EBITDA $113M-$115M
    • Paycom founder and CEO Chad Richison: "This year we further elevated our visibility within the marketplace, improved our client reach and continued to empower businesses nationwide with our powerful, yet intuitive human capital management software solution. With impressive annual revenue growth of 46.5 percent, we bolstered our market share and now serve over 17,800 clients from coast to coast. We also returned value to our stockholders by repurchasing $50 million of common stock, which speaks to the power of our cash-generative business model. As we enter our 20th year of leading organizations in their search for best-in-class HR and payroll solutions, we will continue to provide outstanding levels of customer service and to innovate our technology through our investments in research and development."
    • After hours – (NYSE:PAYC) $50
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

    PayPal -2.1% on disclosure of DOJ probe

    • In its 10-K filing (page 96), PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) discloses the receipt of a subpoena from the Justice Department concerning the company's historical anti-money laundering program.
    • Shares -2.1% after hours.

    Equifax beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

  • IMPV

    Imperva +10.14%; Q4 2016, outlook above estimates

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $78.4M (consensus $70.21M), EPS $0.32 (consensus $0.03)
    • Other developments – Sells Skyfence technology and service to Forcepoint, acquires assets of Camouflage Software.
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $67M-$69M (consensus $66.48M), EPS -$0.06 to -$0.02 (consensus -$0.11), gross margin 80%, operating loss $0.5M-$1.9M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $316M-$319M (consensus $304.96M), EPS $0.31-$0.34 (consensus $0.14), gross margin 80%, operating income $17.8M-$19.2M, capital expenditures $15M-$20M, cash flows from operations positive
    • Imperva president and CEO Anthony Bettencourt: “Our results were driven by the demand of our best-of-breed discovery, protection and compliance solutions, as well as ongoing cost controls. Imperva is well positioned to maintain the momentum in 2017 and beyond, given the growing need for enterprises worldwide to protect their business-critical data and applications.”
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:IMPV) $47.25
    • Conference call
    • Press release
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • CTL

    CenturyLink -1.6% as revenue decline drives Q4 miss

    • CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL) has slipped 1.6% postmarket following misses in its Q4 earnings report that featured light guidance for the coming quarter.
    • Lower strategic revenue growth was a culprit, says CEO Glen Post III: "We are not satisfied with these results and are making progress in a number of areas focused on continuing to improve our customer experience and further positioning CenturyLink for long-term growth."
    • Operating revenue was led lower to $4.29B by declines in legacy voice and low-bandwidth data services revenues. Meanwhile, acquisition costs tied to Level 3 drove an opex increase to $3.9B.
    • Revenue by segment: Business, $2.55B (down 4.1%); Consumer, $1.45B (down 4.3%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenues of $4.23B-$4.29B (below consensus for $4.314B), core revenues of $3.8B-$3.86B, operating cash flow of $1.49B-$1.55B and adjusted EPS of $0.51-$0.57 (below an expected $0.59).
    • Meanwhile, for full 2017, it sees revenues of $17.05B-$17.3B (vs. consensus for $17.19B), core revenues of $15.25B-$15.5B, operating cash flow of $6.15B-$6.35B and EPS of $2.10-$2.30 (vs. $2.25 consensus).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • RYN

    Rayonier beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Rayonier (NYSE:RYN): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $142.8M (+4.2% Y/Y) beats by $15.03M.
    • Shares +1.2%.
    • Press Release

  • PRU

    Prudential +1.75% after earnings beat, dividend hike

    • Q4 after-tax adjusted operating income of $1.09B or $2.46 per share vs. $891M and $1.94 one year ago.
    • Quarterly dividend is boosted to $0.75 per share from $0.70, bringing the annualized yield up to 2.85%. 6.6M shares repurchased during Q4 at average price of $93.84 each. New $1.25B program is announced for this year.
    • Adjusted book value per share of $78.95 up $5.36 for the year (after $2.80 in dividends).
    • U.S. Retirement Solutions and Investment Management adjusted operating income of $964M vs. $776M a year ago. Individual annuities adjusted operating income of $422M vs. $410M; retirement of $318M vs. $168M; asset management of $224M vs. $198M.
    • U.S. Individual Life Segment adjusted operating income of $138M vs. $99M a year ago (though last year's quarter included a one-time $20M charge). Group insurance adjusted operating income of $43M vs. $27M.
    • CC tomorrow at 11 ET
    • Previously: Prudential Financial beats by $0.14 (Feb. 8)
    • PRU +1.75% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 4 Comments

  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate lower on revenue miss though profits rise

    • Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF.A -1.2%, LGF.B -1.4%) A shares are down 1.8% after hours following a miss in fiscal Q3 revenues and a swing to a loss, though profitability rose across all segments.
    • The loss was chiefly due to $52M in restructuring and other costs tied to its integration of Starz, the company said, including $22M in severance costs and $27M in transaction costs as well as a $28M loss on extinguishment of debt.
    • The quarter included 23 days of operations following the closing of the Starz deal. But record-tying Oscar nominee La La Land didn't go to wide release until the close of this quarter and so will be reflected next quarter.
    • Revenues by segment: Motion Pictures, $440M (down 13%); Television Production, $229M (up 38.8%); Media Networks, $85M (new).
    • Profits by segment: Motion Pictures, $51M (up 55%); Television Production, $26M (up 117%); Media Networks, $33M vs. a year-ago loss of $4M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM

  • Comparable sales disappoint at Whole Foods

    • Whole Foods Market reports comparable-store sales fell 2.4% in FQ1 vs. -1.7% consensus estimate
    • Average basket size during the quarter was up 1.5%, more than offset by a 3.9% drop in transactions.
    • The company's gross margin fell off 43 bps Y/Y to 33.6% vs. 33.4% consensus.
    • SG&A expense rate +12 bps to 28.6% of sales.
    • EBITDA was reported at 7.6% of total sales. Adjusted return on invested capital was 12%.
    • Guidance: The company says comparable FQ2 sales through February 5 are down 3.2%. Whole Foods expects FY17 sales growth of 1.7% and EBITDA margin of around 8%.
    • Previously: Whole Foods Market EPS in-line, misses on revenue (Feb. 8)
    • WFM -3.34% after hours to $28.32.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNY

    Sanofi and Regeneron "ain't dead yet" with Praluent, court allows sales to continue during appeal; Amgen down 2% after hours

    • An appellate court grants Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) and Regeneron's (NASDAQ:REGN) motion to stay the injunction related to cholesterol fighter Praluent, thereby allowing sales to continue while they appeal Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) win at the district level.
    • After market action: SNY (+1%); REGN: unch (trading halt); AMGN: (-2%)
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Regeneron and Sanofi strike out in attempt to delay pulling Praluent off market while patent appeal proceeds; withdrawal next month if appellate review fails (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 5 Comments

    OraSure Technologies beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $35.5M (+9.6% Y/Y) beats by $0.7M.
    • Shares +15.8%.

    PCM beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    | 4:26 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile -5.6% after posting miss in fiscal Q4

    • Glu Mobile (GLUU -2.4%) has slid after hours, -5.6%, after posting Q4 results where it missed on top and bottom lines but looked ahead to a return to profit.
    • Revenues fell to $46.3M from a year-ago $61M, and bookings dipped fractionally to $57.8M. Gross margin was 56%, vs. a year-ago 58%.
    • Meanwhile, net loss widened to $17.2M -- a loss of $0.13 on a per-share basis, vs. a year-ago loss of $0.02/share.
    • Cash and equivalents were $102.1M as of Dec. 31, against no debt.
    • “In 2017 we will be focused on hiring proven creative leaders with a track record of success," says CEO Nick Earl. "We will be investing in these creative leaders to build platform titles that we expect will share similar characteristics with Tap Sports Baseball and Covet Fashion of more predictable bookings and year over year growth."
    • It's guiding to fiscal Q1 bookings of $53M-$55M, and full-year bookings of $215M-$225M.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 4 Comments

    Westell Technologies beats by $0.02, misses on revenue

    • Revenue of $15M (-25.8% Y/Y) misses by $1.69M.

    Paycom beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

  • OCRX

    Ocera up 31%; Zacks upgrades to Buy with $0.75 price target

    • Nano cap Ocera Therapeutics (OCRX +30.9%) jumps on a whopping 55x surge in volume on no particular news. Zacks Investment Research upgraded it to Buy today with a $0.75 price target, over 20% below the intraday high of $0.95.
    • Two other shops that recently updated coverage, H.C. Wainwright and Aegis, are bullish as well with price targets of $4 and $3, respectively.
    • The company's lead product candidate is Phase 2-stage ornithine phenylacetate for the treatment of hospitalized patients with hepatic encephalopathy. Shares plunged in late January on the news that the STOP-HE study failed to achieve its primary endpoint.
    • Previously: Ocera's lead product candidate flunks mid-stage HE study; shares plummet 59% premarket (Jan. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • GG

    Goldcorp buys New Gold’s El Morro gold stream for $65M

    • Goldcorp (GG +0.9%) agrees to acquire New Gold’s (NGD +5.8%) 4% gold stream in its El Morro mine in Chile for $65M.
    • El Morro is one of Chile's largest mines, with in situ reserves estimated at 6.7M oz. of gold and 4.9B lbs. of copper, and is part of a 50/50 joint venture with Teck Resources (TECK -1.5%) that combines the Relincho and El Morro deposits.
    • NGD sold its 30% share in El Morro to GG in 2015; the 4% gold stream was part of th3 2015 deal, but now that also has been sold to GG.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 8 Comments
  • PKG

    Analysts see little impact from Packaging Corp plant accident

    • Investors are getting a crack at Packaging Corp of America (NYSE:PKG) at a discount, according to Jefferies, Wells Fargo and Buckingham.
    • All three firms think the 1.6% drop in share price after a fatal accident at a plant in Louisiana was reported is unwarranted with production likely to be unaffected.
    • Previously: Fatal accident reported at Packaging Corp of America plant (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEE

    NY Post: Henkel in talks to buy Sealed Air’s professional cleaning unit

    • Sealed Air (SEE +1.6%) moves higher following a NY Post report that German consumer conglomerate Henkel (OTCPK:HENKY) is in talks to buy its professional cleaning unit, possibly for more than $3B.
    • A sale could fetch in excess of $3B, according to the report, but SEE bought the Diversey unit for $4.3B in 2011.
    • SEE announced in October it planned to spin off Diversey, as well as its food hygiene and cleaning businesses to shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural +3.7% after Q4 earnings beat; production, reserves rise

    • Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.7%) pushes higher after easily beating Q4 earnings expectations, as Permian Basin production continues to roll on.
    • PXD says it produced 242K boe/day during Q4 (59% oil), up 3% Q/Q and at the top end of company guidance of 237K-242K boe/day, the seventh consecutive quarter of production growth since the oil price collapse in late 2014.
    • At the same time, FY 2016 production costs per boe fell 29% Y/Y, driven by cost reduction initiatives and the growth of low-cost Spraberry and Wolfcamp horizontal production.
    • PXD also says it added 205M boe of proved reserves during 2016 from discoveries, extensions and technical revisions of previous estimates, equating to a drillbit reserve replacement of 232% of full-year production of 88M boe.
    • PXD showed plenty of swagger in today's earnings conference call, saying it aims to pump out 1M boe/day - 4x last year's total - by 2026; "It's only a matter of how much capital we want to put to work," CEO Tim Dove said.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • DECK

    Marcato Capital discloses 6% stake in Deckers Outdoor

    • Deckers Outdoor (DECK +7.2%) shoots higher after Marcato Capital Management discloses that it holds a 6.0% stake in the retailer.
    • Marcato says it plans to engage in talks with Deckers management.
    • SEC Form 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 4 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: AEHR +41%. COHR +18%. INVE +13%. JIVE +11%. LITE +11%.

    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • JEC

    Jacobs -3.8% as petroleum and chemical sales cut nearly in half

    • Jacobs Engineering (JEC -3.8%) is lower as its Q4 results reveal a 10% Y/Y drop in revenues, led by a decline in its petroleum and chemicals segment.
    • JEC's Q4 industrial revenue, the company's largest segment, rose 12% Y/Y to $752M, but sales in petroleum and chemicals, the second largest segment, sank 47% to $642M.
    • JEC says total backlog at year-end 2016 was $18.1B, including a professional services component of $12.2B, vs. an $18.2B backlog with a $11.4B professional services component in the year-ago period.
    • JEC's "margin performance in the quarter is a positive but the revenue miss is a reminder that end markets will likely remain challenging over the intermediate term," Wells Fargo analysts say.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • ECR

    Eclipse Resources +6% as Q4 output tops high end of guidance

    • Eclipse Resources (ECR +6%) is higher after reporting that net production averaged 255M cfe/day during Q4, exceeding the high end of the company's guidance range, and 229M cfe/day for FY 2016, above the midpoint of previously issued guidance.
    • ECR says year-end proved resources rose 35% to 469B cfe based on SEC pricing, and by 108% to 1.2T cfe based on forward strip pricing.
    • ECR establishes a $300M capital budget for 2017, and forecasts full-year production of 305M-315M cfe/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 6 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix keeps churning higher

    • Netflix (NFLX +0.5%) keeps tacking on gains as it extends on its post-earnings run.
    • Shares of NFLX hit a new high water mark of $145.07 earlier today.
    • On Wall Street, bull ratings outnumber bear ratings by a 7-to-1 ratio, while on Seeking Alpha the views from contributors are more evenly split due to the valuation question mark.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 15 Comments
  • ABB

    ABB -3.5% as continued uncertainty highlighted

    • ABB (ABB -3.6%) sinks after Q4 net income of $489M came in well short of analyst consensus for $543M and the company's comments offer an uncertain outlook for 2017.
    • ABB says quarterly orders rose for the first time since Q1 2015, gaining 3% Y/Y to $8.28B, yet momentum "isn’t that strong yet, CEO Ulrich Spiesshofer says in echoing rival Siemens, which last week also gave a cautious outlook for orders and warned that a Q4 decline would extend into 2017.
    • Increased uncertainty stemming from the U.K.’s decision to leave the European Union as well as geopolitical tensions in other parts of the world are overshadowing global markets, leading to a likely “transitional year,” the company says.
    • "The bigger picture today is that ABB has returned to growth, despite all of the lingering order concerns," Morgan Stanley analysts say, but Goldman Sachs notes ABB's book-to-bill came in below 1x across all divisions and points to a tough environment for EPS growth in coming quarters.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • NGL

    NGL Energy Partners downgraded at Stifel as FQ3 below expectations

    • NGL Energy Partners (NGL -1.8%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $21 price target, trimmed from $22, at Stifel, after FQ3 adjusted EBITDA of $120.6M came in below expectations.
    • NGL reiterated FY 2017 EBITDA guidance of $485M-$500M but reduced its outlook to the lower end of guidance; FY 2018 guidance was maintained, although management provided initial expectations of $100M of growth capital with little dedicated to acquisitions, Stifel says.
    • The firm says it is encouraged by NGL's resumption of distribution growth and optimistic outlook, but it believes units reflect majority of the upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 4 Comments

    Mid-day spike for International Paper

    • International Paper (NYSE:IP) is up 2.60% in a quick high-volume move that appears related to a report of a fatal explosion at a Packaging Corp of America plant.

    Fatal accident reported at Packaging Corp of America plant

    • Packaging Corp of America (NYSE:PKG) is down 1.95% on reports of an explosion in Louisiana.
    • Local TV affiliate KPLC broke the story and reports that there are three fatalities.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • SSC-OLD

    Wecast Networks up 20%, hitting two-year highs

    • Wecast Networks (WCST) is up 20.3% on many trading multiples of its standard thin volume today.
    • More than 1.26M shares have changed hands vs. its standard volume of 98,325 shares.
    • The video-on-demand provider has undergone a number of company machinations in the past few months at the hands of honcho Bruno Wu and his other businesses. After closing on Sun Video Group last week, it added majority control of media/events firm Wide Angle Group.
    • Also last week, Chief Operating Officer Yi Xu took over as interim chief financial officer following the resignation of Mei Chen.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: AEHR +48%. APOP +29%. WCST +18%. KFRC +17%. COHR +17%. PLG +17%. UVV +16%. TSRO +14%. XGTI +12%. CJJD +12%.
    • Losers: GALE -41%. OTC:ACUR -27%. EYES -26%. RGSE -24%. SPSC -18%. TDW -16%. DRYS -15%. ORBK -15%. PIP -15%. FXCM -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ZG

    Zillow Group -7%+; Needham & Company, elsewhere reiterate positively

    • Analyst Kerry Rice (Needham & Company): "We are incrementally more positive on Zillow's ability to drive revenue growth towards the high-20% level in FY17 as the recently launched self-service, auction-pricing gains traction, high value seller leads increase as a percentage lead mix, and new agent tools lift conversions. Despite the weaker than expected FY17 EBITDA guide as a result of its continued investments in the development of agent tools and new construction vertical, we believe guidance could prove conservative as Zillow gains sales and marketing leverage.” Price target from $40 to $41 (ZG current price $34.24, Z $34.25).
    • Associated Overweight/Outperform/Buy ratings are similarly reiterated at RBC Capital Markets, Stephens, SunTrust Robinson Humphrey, JMP Securities and elsewhere with broad themes suggesting overly conservative guidance and weakness an acquiring opportunity, while Mizuho Securities and Cowen and Company reiterate neutral positions, with respective $33 and $37 targets.
    • (ZG -7.7%), (Z -7.1%)
    • Previously (February 7, 2017): Zillow -5.8%+; Q4 2016 over expectations, high end of revenue forecasts at consensus
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • DRYS

    DryShips -16% as investors try to sort through earnings

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) is down 15.6% after the company posted Q4 results.
    • The company ended the quarter with cash/cash equivalents of $243M and book value of its vessels of $95M net.
    • In an optimistic outlook, CEO George Economou says the company can "opportunistically" acquire vessels at prices close to historic lows.
    • Previously: DryShips reports Q4 results (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 22 Comments
  • VOYA

    Voya Financial -3.9% as one-time items fuel headline beat

    • Q4 operating earnings of $0.91 per share topped estimates by $0.12, but included $0.17 of non-recurring gains.
    • Retirement adjusted operating earnings of $143M up from $126M a year ago. Net inflows of $803M vs. $557M. AUM of $121B vs. $111B.
    • Investment Management adjusted operating earnings of $65M vs. $42M a year ago. Operating margin, excluding investment capital results of 31.1% vs. 32.7% (non-recurring favorable expense items in Q4 of 2015). Net inflows of $600M vs. outflows of $1.6B.
    • Annuities adjusted operating earnings of $67M vs. $52M a year ago.
    • Individual Life adjusted operating earnings of $45M down from $97M. Results hurt by unfavorable mortality experience in Q4 vs. favorable experience in Q4 2015.
    • Earnings call presentation slides
    • Previously: Voya Financial beats by $0.12 (Feb. 8)
    • VOYA -3.9%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDXG

    Interpace closes equity offering

    • Interpace Diagnostics (IDXG +3.6%) closes its public offering of 1.2M shares of common stock at $3 per share. Underwriters purchased an additional 108K shares. Gross proceeds were ~$3.9M.

  • FOX

    Fox trading down after UK law proposal that could dent pursuit of Sky

    • Proposals in the British Parliament could put hurdles in the path of Rupert Murdoch as his Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX -1.6%, FOXA -1.3%) pursues a buyout of the rest of pay-TV firm Sky (OTCPK:SKYAY +0.1%).
    • MP David Puttnam -- also a film director -- is proposing a "fit-and-proper" test for broadcast licensing, one that would examine corporate-governance failures and past criminal wrongdoing.
    • That would mean new scrutiny for the Murdochs over the phone-hacking scandal that enveloped News Corp. publications in the UK. The scandal had put the brakes on an earlier bid for Sky.
    • The government is facing an anti-Fox campaign pressing for regulator Ofcom to review the deal on whether it's in the public interest.
    • “We don’t think this is going to derail the bid at all,” says research analyst Alice Enders. “It’s not going to interfere with the process of regulatory clearance at the European Commission.”

  • DFFN

    Results from Diffusion Pharma's Phase 1/2 study of TSC in brain cancer demonstrated increased survival; shares up 10%

    • Data from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing Diffusion Pharmaceuticals' (DFFN +9.8%) trans sodium crocetinate (TSC) in newly diagnosed glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) showed a treatment benefit. The results (abstract) have been published in the current edition of the Journal of Neurosurgery.
    • Data from 59 patients showed that 36.3% of those who received the full dose (n=18/50) of TSC were alive at two years, compared to the historical rate of 27 - 30%. Survival in the biopsy-only subset of patients was 40% and 42.9% for those undergoing a complete resection before treatment.
    • Lead product candidate TSC promotes the diffusion of oxygen through blood plasma and into the hypoxic (oxygen deprived) tumor microenvironment. Cancer cells thrive in hypoxic environments which involve changes that make the tumors resistant to treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
